main event: An unidentified flying object was reported by four witnesses in Hibbing, Minnesota on March 28, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as having a greenish glow and shaped like a plywood barrel,The sighting lasted for approximately four seconds,The object was descending from north to south at a 45-degree angle,No visible means of propulsion or control were observed,The reliability of the witnesses was considered exceptionally high.
witness description: two citizens considered exceptional reliable, including a foot specialist and a former Air Force pilot
